Chevrolet Cruze 0-60 times

Autotk.com offers accurate information on Chevrolet Cruze 0-60 times and quarter mile from trusted sources. You may also keep track of how 0-60 times of Chevrolet Cruze changed across years and check out the model’s competitors with the same acceleration performance.

Our mission is to present an easy-to-read and comprehensive information on Chevrolet Cruze 0-60 mph and quarter mile for the devoted geeks, as it is an essential indicator of the vehicle power.

Introduction


In a world full of competitive sedan models that are aiming to offer specifications that are better than the present competitors exists the 2019 Chevrolet Cruze diesel sedan. The Cruze, a popular sedan that is being provided by Chevrolet is faced by a lot of competition from companies that offer sedans with similar or better specifications. Chevrolet, therefore, does its best to improve on the current specs to stay relevant in the market. The Cruze hatchback was introduced last year by Chevrolet to offer more cargo-carrying capacity than the sedan and also a new diesel-powered engine that can cover 50 mpg on the highway. This year Chevrolet is offering a Cruze hatchback diesel for the first time as a combined model with both specifications.

 

0-60 and Engine specs


Though the two engines and two automatic transmissions are similar to the older Sedan version, the six-speed manual has been changed. The take rate has been cited to be of just a couple percent by GM. The turbocharged 1.4-liter inline-four with 153 horsepower and 177 lb-ft of torque pairs with six-speed automatic, Chevrolet estimates its fuel economy as up to 40 mpg highway for the sedan and 38 mpg for the hatchback.  The Cruze diesel sedan is expected to offer even better fuel economy with its 137-hp 1.6-liter turbo-diesel with its sturdy 240 lb-ft. The expectations are impressive except the 2018 Cruze diesel sedan with the manual posted a 52-mpg highway rating.

 

Exterior & Interior


The most obvious improvement to the 2019 Cruze is the fact that the front styling is more or less parallel to the revised 2019 Malibu. Other changes on the 2019 Cruze diesel sedan do not stand out as much as the already stated compact’s successful visual formula which has constantly been presented since this generation debuted in 2016. The headlights, taillights with LED on the top Premier trim and wheel designs that will be tougher to spot as compared to previous models. The Redline Package lends some of its specifications to the Cruze diesel sedan such as the black window surrounds, badges and alloy wheels.

The interior consists of the new Infotainment 3 system which is a reskinned version of Cadillac’s latest version of the CUE. The Infotainment system is managed by a 7.0-inch touchscreen that responds to swiping gestures. Higher trims with navigation allow for user profiles to be stored and loaded to the cloud to allow transfer of a driver’s home screen, audio presets, saved destinations and contacts to any other compatible Chevy. Also included are wireless software updates and live traffic. The interior regarding seats is carried over from previous models except for a new brown leatherette on the Premier and black trim on all models.

 

Verdict


The 2019 Chevrolet Cruze is expected to benefit from a mid-cycle refresh. The Cruze lineup has been expanding since the compact car debuted initially in the year 2016. The list now includes not just the initial sedan but also a four-door hatchback and a vehicle with higher mileage diesel option in both the available body styles.
